intro: Landolphia thollonii, commonly known as the African moon vine, is a climbing shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant produces fleshy, berry-like fruits that are typically green when immature and turn red when ripe. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated for both horticultural and traditional uses.
